00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the basic parse tree node.  Subclasses of this class
00004 #  are things like binary operator, function call, and so on.
00005 #
00006 package Parser::Item;
00007 use strict; no strict "refs";
00008 use UNIVERSAL;
00009 use Scalar::Util;
00010 
00011 #
00012 #  Make these available to Parser items
00013 #
00014 sub isa {UNIVERSAL::isa(@_)}
00015 sub can {UNIVERSAL::can(@_)}
00016 
00017 sub weaken {Scalar::Util::weaken((shift)->{equation})}
00018 
00019 #
00020 #  Return the class name of an item
00021 #
00022 sub class {
00023   my @parts = split(/::/,ref(shift));
00024   return $parts[(scalar(@parts) > 2 ? -2 : -1)];
00025 }
00026 
00027 #
00028 #  Get the equation context
00029 #
00030 sub context {
00031   my $self = shift;
00032   return (ref($self) ? $self->{equation}{context} : Value->context);
00033 }
00034 
00035 #
00036 #  Get the package for a given Parser class
00037 #
00038 sub Item {
00039   my $self = shift; my $class = shift;
00040   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00041   return $context->{parser}{$class} if defined $context->{parser}{$class};
00042   return "Parser::$class" if defined @{"Parser::${class}::ISA"};
00043   Value::Error("No such package 'Parser::%s'",$class);
00044 }
00045 
00046 #
00047 #  Same but for Value classes
00048 #
00049 sub Package {
00050   my $self = shift; my $class = shift;
00051   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00052   $context->Package($class);
00053 }
00054 
00055 #
00056 #  Get various type information
00057 #
00058 sub type {my $self = shift; return $self->{type}{name}}
00059 sub typeRef {my $self = shift; return $self->{type}}
00060 sub length {my $self = shift; return $self->{type}{length}}
00061 sub entryType {
00062   my $self = shift; my $type = $self->{type};
00063   return $type->{list} ? $type->{entryType}: $type;
00064 }
00065 
00066 #
00067 #  True if two types agree
00068 #
00069 sub typeMatch {
00070   my ($ltype,$rtype) = @_;
00071   return 0 if ($ltype->{name} ne $rtype->{name});
00072   return 1 if (!$ltype->{list} && !$rtype->{list});
00073   return 0 if ($ltype->{list} != $rtype->{list});
00074   return 0 if ($ltype->{length} ne $rtype->{length});
00075   return typeMatch($ltype->{entryType},$rtype->{entryType});
00076 }
00077 
00078 #
00079 #  Check if an item is a number, complex, etc.
00080 #
00081 sub isRealNumber {my $self = shift; return $self->isNumber && !$self->isComplex}
00082 sub isNumber {my $self = shift; return ($self->typeRef->{name} eq 'Number')}
00083 sub isComplex {
00084   my $self = shift; my $type = $self->typeRef;
00085   return ($type->{name} eq 'Number' && $type->{length} == 2);
00086 }
00087 sub isNumOrInfinity {
00088   my $self = shift;
00089   return ($self->isRealNumber || $self->{isInfinite});
00090 }
00091 
00092 #
00093 #  Check if an item is a unary negation
00094 #
00095 sub isNeg {
00096   my $self = shift;
00097   return ($self->class eq 'UOP' && $self->{uop} eq 'u-' && !$self->{op}->{isInfinite});
00098 }
00099 
00100 #
00101 #  Check if an item can be in a union or is a set or reals
00102 #    (overridden in subclasses)
00103 #
00104 sub canBeInUnion {0}
00105 sub isSetOfReals {(shift)->type =~ m/^(Interval|Union|Set)$/}
00106 
00107 #
00108 #  Add parens to an expression (alternating the type of paren)
00109 #
00110 sub addParens {
00111   my $self = shift; my $string = shift;
00112   if ($string =~ m/^[^\[]*\(/) {return '['.$string.']'}
00113   return '('.$string.')';
00114 }
00115 
00116 #
00117 #  These are stubs for the subclasses
00118 #
00119 sub getVariables {{}}   #  find out what variables are used
00120 sub makeList {shift}    #  flatten a tree of commas into a list
00121 sub makeMatrix {}       #  convert a list to a matrix
00122 
00123 sub reduce {shift}
00124 sub substitute {shift}
00125 sub string {}
00126 sub TeX {}
00127 sub perl {}
00128 
00129 sub ijk {
00130   my $self = shift;
00131   $self->Error("Can't use method 'ijk' with objects of type '%s'",$self->type);
00132 }
00133 
00134 #
00135 #  Recursively copy an item, and set a new equation pointer, if any
00136 #
00137 sub copy {
00138   my $self = shift; my $equation = shift;
00139   my $new = {%{$self}};
00140   if (ref($self) ne 'HASH') {
00141     $new->{equation} = $equation if defined($equation);
00142     $new->{ref} = undef;
00143     bless $new, ref($self);
00144     $new->weaken;
00145   }
00146   $new->{type} = copy($self->{type}) if defined($self->{type});
00147   return $new;
00148 }
00149 
00150 #
00151 #  Report an error message
00152 #
00153 sub Error {
00154   my $self = shift;
00155   my $message = shift; $message = [$message,@_] if scalar(@_) > 0;
00156   $self->{equation}->Error($message,$self->{ref}) if defined($self->{equation});
00157   Parser->Error($message);
00158 }
